title: Twenty-four caprices. Opus 1 for solo violin - Nicolo Paganini (1782-1840)
creator_contributor_role: University of Michigan. School of Music, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Music - Instruction and study
Music & Performing Arts/Music - Instruction and study
abstract: No. 1, E major--No. 2, B minor--No. 3, E minor--No. 4, C minor--No. 5, A minor--No. 6, G minor--No. 7, A minor--No. 8, E flat major--No. 9, E major--No. 10, G minor--No. 11, C major--No. 12, A flat major--No. 13, B flat major--No. 14, E flat major--No. 15, E minor--No. 16, G minor--No. 17, E flat major--No. 18, C major--No. 19, E flat major--No. 20, D major--No. 21, A major--No. 22, F major--No. 23, E flat major--No. 24, A minor
description: Considered the greatest interpreter of the works of Niccolo Paganini, violinist Ruggiero Ricci, on 10 January 1987, became the first violinist to record on video tape, Paganini's "Twenty-four caprices" in one complete program. This is an unedited tape of that performance.
